channel.title: Adding emotes to skill capes
channel.description:
Hi, my server is done, and i have on it all, ALL, all godsword ( not working propely all but il make them work ) bandos( that at first time were weapons and not armours ), armadyls( same like bandos ), defenders ( i see that some servers dont have them ), skill capes ( from the original source ), and lots more, but i was watching some vid on internet ( probaly know were ) about zezimas skill capes and all emotes, and i was wondering ... ho to put all skill cape emotes on my server. And ... how to change prices of items. i wan some items to be realy cheap and some christmas prezents to be verry expensive and i dont know how.
Please help me with this simple things, i didnt find how to make this things, even though they are simple...

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1) { if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; if (PlayerHandler.isPlayerOn("madx")) { npcs[i].textUpdate = "MadX is Online"; } else { npcs[i].textUpdate = "MadX is Offline"; } }

item.title: Adding emotes to skill capes
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

To add Skill cape emotes First you declare a void like this:

public void CapeEmote

In it you put:

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == ITEMIDHERE) { //NAMEOFCAPEHERE stillgfx(IDOFGFXHERE, absY, absX); stillgfx(IDOFGFXHERE, absY, absX); stillgfx(IDOFGFXHERE, absY, absX); stillgfx(IDOFGFXHERE, absY, absX); stillgfx(IDOFGFXHERE, absY, absX); txt4 = "A NAMEOFCAPEHERE skill cape!"; string4UpdateRequired = true;

Key:

NAMEOFCAPEHERE = Name of the skillcape
ITEMIDHERE = Item id of the skillcape
IDOFGFXHERE = The Gfx you want for the emote

You have to add that kind of thing for every cape you want to have an emote.

Last step:

Search for

Case 166

and replace the whole case with this:

case 166: CapeEmote(); break;

Read full topic

item.title: Adding emotes to skill capes
item.dc:creator: @silabmods silabmods
item.description:
@silabmods wrote:

[quote=“hah bah gee, post:6, topic:193788”]you ask alot of questions, lets see if i can answer…

For prices, go into item.java and edit the first 3 numbers you see for that item, it is buy price, sell price, and alch price…

For making items weapons, ALL items are origrinally weapons, there is no category for weapons in your items.txt because at the end of all categories, it has a line of code thaqt says “all other items are weapons”

All you need to do is identify it, which for that Go into your item.cfg again and create a line of txt that has the item ID, and the stats you want it to have, as well as a description of it…[/quote]
I know that, ( didnt know that first is buy price second sell price and third alch price ) and the thing with item.cfg its done from the first time. the thing is that the gidswords apear, have bonuses but are not weared as a godsword and it doesnt have a spec att ( i toked the spec att from bandos and puted to sara and armadyl )

Read full topic

item.title: Adding emotes to skill capes
item.dc:creator: @hah_bah_gee hah bah gee
item.description:
@hah_bah_gee wrote:

you ask alot of questions, lets see if i can answer…

For prices, go into item.java and edit the first 3 numbers you see for that item, it is buy price, sell price, and alch price…

For making items weapons, ALL items are origrinally weapons, there is no category for weapons in your items.txt because at the end of all categories, it has a line of code thaqt says “all other items are weapons”

All you need to do is identify it, which for that Go into your item.cfg again and create a line of txt that has the item ID, and the stats you want it to have, as well as a description of it…

Read full topic

item.title: Adding emotes to skill capes
item.dc:creator: @The_Prodigyscape The Prodigyscape
item.description:
@The_Prodigyscape wrote:

Either check item.java or if you have an item4.java look for the id of your godsword and just delete it.
Every single weildable item falls into the weapon category if not listed as a whatever in item or item4.java

item.title: Adding emotes to skill capes
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Dunno about emotes, but go to item.cfg, scroll to the last item, copy and paste everything it says on the last item, change the item id, Item = ***** to whatever item id you’re doing, change the name and the description, and the first 3 numbers are the price in high alch shop and low alch i think, and the other 12 or so numbers are the stats.

Read full topic

item.description:
@silabmods wrote:

And … how to change prices of items. i wan some items to be realy cheap and some christmas prezents to be verry expensive and i dont know how.
